thread.title: Astros fans thrilled at first, then feel agony of Monday's Game 4 loss
thread.title_full: Astros fans thrilled at first, then feel agony of Monday's Game 4 loss

title: Astros fans thrilled at first, then feel agony of Monday's Game 4 loss
text:
Show Transcript Hide Transcript 
THIS IS TALKING APART. DEFINITELY. SIMONE, THANK YOU. JONATHAN MARTINEZ CONTINUES OUR TEAM COVERAGE FROM MINUTE MAID PARK. THERE HAS BEEN SO MUCH EXCITEMENT SURROUNDING THIS GAME. YEAH, TALK ABOUT TOYING WITH YOUR EMOTIONS. ASTROS THOUGHT THEY WERE COASTING TO VICTORY. YOU CAN SEE BEHIND ME, DOZENS AND DOZENS OF FANS, UP TO HUNDREDS AND HUNDREDS OF FANS NOW FILING OUT, ALL IN THAT SEA OF ORANGE. WE THOUGHT WE HAD IT WRAPPED UP, BUT AS YOU JUST TALKED ABOUT, MELTDOWN IN THE EIGHTH WHEN THE ROYCE TOOK THE LEAD AND SO FAR THEY ARE STILL IN THE LEAD. WE CAUGHT UP WITH ONE FAN RIGHT NOW. WE'RE CATCHING UP WITH ONE FAN WHO WAS IN THERE WATCHING IT ALL GO DOWN. WHAT WERE YOUR THOUGHTS IN THERE? IF YOU GO BACK 10 YEARS AGO, ASTROS HAD A HARD TIME WINNING IT, CAME BACK AND WON THE SERIES. SAME THING HAPPENED HERE. HISTORY IS GOING TO REPEAT ITSELF, AND GO ASTROS, STILL HAVE FAITH. DIE-HARD FAN. Reporter: SO WIN OR LOSE, LET'S SAY THEY DON'T GET THE WIN, WHAT DO YOU THINK ABOUT THE FUTURE AND THE OUTLOOK? IT'S BRIGHT. YOUNG TALENT, YOUNG PROSPECT, NEW OWNER COMING IN, MAKING CHANGES AND USING OUR DRAFT PICKS, HEY, I LIKE IT, SO IT'S A BRIGHT FUTURE AHEAD OF US. Reporter: YOU'VE STILL GOT HOPE, EVEN IF WE WERE TO LOSE TODAY. NO. WE'LL GO TO KANSAS CITY AND TAKE THE WIN. Reporter: WHAT DO YOU THINK AS FAR AS GOING ALL OF THE WAY TO THE WORLD SERIES? ONE GAME AT A TIME. Reporter: THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME. SOME FANS STILL VERY OPTIMISTIC OUT HERE. WE MAY HAVE HAD A MELTDOWN IN THE EIGHTH, WE MAY LOSE THE GAME, HOPEFULLY WE WON'T, HOPEFULLY WE CAN WIN IT HERE, BUT IF PERHAPS WE DON'T, WE WILL TAKE CARE OF BUSINESS IN KANSAS CITY. THAT'S WHAT ALL OF THE FANS ARE SAYING. FOR NOW, WE'LL CHECK BACK IN A LITTLE BIT LATER. WE ARE REPORTING LIVE OUTSIDE MINUTE MAID PARK, JONATHAN MARTINEZ, KPRC CHANNEL 2 NEWS. KEEP IT POSITIVE, JONATHAN. THANK YOU. FANS HAD BEEN ON EDGE WAITING FOR THE OUTCOME OF THE GAME. THEY MIGHT BE DREADING THE OUTCOME, BUT STILL HAVE SOME TIME THERE. RECALL ON, THEY WERE REALLY EXCITED, THEY WERE CHEERING, BUT AS WE'VE BEEN REPORTING, THAT REALLY ALL TOOK A TURN IN THAT 8th INNING. RYAN KORSGARD HAS BEEN WITH FANS DOWNTOWN AT LUCK U.I.L.'S. RYAN, A HUGE ROLLERCOASTER. Reporter: IT ABSOLUTELY HAS BEEN. PEOPLE HAVEN'T MOVED, THEY HAVE WATCHED T.V. ALL AFTERNOON. THEY WERE STARTING TO CELEBRATE A LITTLE BIT EARLIER, AND NOT NECESSARILY THE CASE 2340U, SIMPLY GLUED TO THIS LAST INNING, HOPING IT ALL WORKS. ONE OF THE PEOPLE WHO HAS BEEN HERE ALL AFTERNOON TOLD ME EARLIER, IT REALLY FELT GOOD. NOW, NOT SO MUCH. IT REALLY LOOKED GOOD. Reporter: AND NOW? WE'LL SEE WHAT HAPPENS. Reporter: DESCRIBE IT. NOBODY'S MOVING, NOBODY'S GOING ANYWHERE. EVERYBODY IS ON PINS AND NEEDLES. THE MOMENTUM WAS GOOD, BUT WE'LL GET IT BACK. Reporter: FINGERS CROSSED. WE APPRECIATE IT. MELISSA IS TAKING PICTURES. WHAT DO YOU THINK OF THIS? MAN, IT'S DISAPPOINTING, BUT AT THE SAME TIME, LET'S GO ASTROS! Reporter: WE'RE TRYING TO. ABSOLUTELY. Reporter: YOU CAN SEE MORE FANS, PEOPLE ARE ALL PUMPED UP, RIGHT OVER HERE, ALL OF THESE TABLES ARE CHEERING. THEY ARE NOT GIVING UP. THEY WERE ALL EXCITED EARLIER, THEY'RE EXCITED ONCE AGAIN STILL. [ Cheers ] Reporter: SO IF YOU ASK THESE GUYS, THEY THINK WE CAN PROBABLY MAKE IT HAPPEN. KEITH, SARA, BACK TO YOU. RYAN, THANK YOU. ON CLICK2VOTE.COM, WE'VE BEEN ASKING ALL AFTERNOON HOW FAR YOU THINK THE ASTROS ARE GOING TO GO. KEITH? RIGHT NOW, FANS STILL TREMENDOUSLY HOPEFUL, 87% NOW, HIGH OF 80% SAYING THAT WE'RE GOING TO GO TO THE WORLD SERIES. GOT TO KEEP IT POSITIVE, AS KEITH GARVIN WOULD SAY. YOU CAN KEEP ON VOTING THROUGH OUR AFTERNOON NEWSCAST. WE WILL REVEAL THE FINAL RESULTS COMING UP AT 6:00. AND ON OUR CHANNEL 2 FACEBOOK PAGE, WE ASKED YOU HOW YOU TOOK IN ALL OF THE GAME ACTION TODAY, PERHAPS AT THE PARK OR EVEN AT HOME. MAYBE AT A BAR ON A MONDAY AFTERNOON. MARGUERITE SAYS SHE WAS AT RUDY'S IN LEAGUE CITY HAVING BARBECUE. GOOD PLACE TO BE. BARBECUE IS GOOD ANY TIME OF DAY. JENNIFER SAYS AT HOME WHILE WORKING, KIND OF. KIRSTEN SAYS AT HOME WATCHING THE GAME ON T.V. AND LISTENING ON THE RADIO. THAT'S A GOOD WAY TO DO IT. RICARDO SAYS ON-LINE PHONE HIDING AT WORK, L.O.L.. HOUSTON - 
Monday afternoon at Luckyâ€™s was a story of great highs and lows. 
When the Astros were winning, the bar in the shadows of Minute Maid Park was alive. 
"This is what we've been expecting for the last 10 years and we were hoping for this and we're happy that it's happening," fan Chris Alvarez said. "Whether we win or lose, we're still fans of the Astros. That's our team." Quick Clicks
